gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਚਾਰ ਜੋਜਨ ਲੳੁ ਚਾਰ ਕੋਸੰ ॥
transliteration: Kite Chaar Jojan Lau Chaar Kosan||
translation: Many serpents from the length of four Yajanas upto four kos,

gurmukhi: ਛੁਅੈ ਘ੍ਰਿਤ ਜੈਸੇ ਕਰੈ ਅਗਨ ਹੋਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Chhuai Ghrit Jaise Darai Agad Homan||
translation: Were burnt in the altar-fire, as though the fire was touching the clarified butter.
While burning, the snakes fluttered their hoods, frothed and hissed.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟੈ ਲਪਟ ਜੁਅਾਲਾ ਬਸੈ ਬਿੱਖ ਧਾਰੰ ॥੪॥੧੭੨॥
transliteration: Chhoutai Lapat Juaalaa Basai Bikkh Dhaaran||4||172||
translation: When they fell in the fire, the flame flared up.4.172.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਸਪਤ ਜੋਜਨ ਲੌ ਕੋਸ ਅਸਟੰ ॥
transliteration: Kite Sapt Jojan Lau Kos Astan||
translation: Many serpents from the length of seven upto eight Kos,

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਅਸਟ ਜੋਜਨ ਮਹਾ ਧਰਮ ਪੁਸਟੰ ॥
transliteration: Kite Ast Jojan Mahaa Dharam Poustan||
translation: Many of the length of eight Yojanas and very fat;

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਘੋਰ ਬੱਧੰ ਜਰੇ ਕੋਟ ਨਾਗੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhajyo Ghor Baddhan Dare Kot Naagadg||
translation: Millions of snakes were thus burnt and there was great killing.
Takshak, the king of snakes ran away like the crow from the falcon for fear of being eaten.5.173.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਲੰ ਕੋਟ ਹੋਮੇ ਬਿਖੈ ਵਹਿਣ ਕੁੰਡੰ ॥
transliteration: Kulan Kot Home Bikhai Vaihan Koundan||
translation: Millions of serpents of his clan were burnt in the fire-altar.

gurmukhi: ਬਚੇ ਬਾਧ ਡਾਰੇ ਘਨੇ ਕੁੰਡ ਝੁੰਡੰ ॥
transliteration: Bache Baadh Ddare Ghane Kound Jhoundan||
translation: Those who were saved, were bound down and collectively thrown in the fire-pit.

gurmukhi: ਭਜਯੋ ਨਾਗ ਰਾਜੰ ਤਕਯੋ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਲੋਕੰ ॥
transliteration: Bhajyo Naag Raajan Takyo Indra Lokan||
translation: The king of Nagas ran away and took sheleter in the world of Indra.

gurmukhi: ਜਰਯੋ ਬੇਦ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੰ ਭਰਯੋ ਸੰਕ੍ਰ ਸੋਕੰ ॥੬॥੧੭੪॥
transliteration: Daryo Bed Mantran Bdaryo Sankra Sokan||6||174||
translation: With the power of Vedic mantras, the Abode of Indra also began to broil and with this, Indra was in great agony.6.174.

gurmukhi: ਬਧਯੋ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੰ ਜੰਤ੍ਰੰ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਭੂਮ ਮੱਧੰ ॥
transliteration: Badhyo Mantran Jantran Giryo Bhoom Maddhan||
translation: Bound by mantras and tantras, (Takshak) ultimately fell on the earth.
At that the great adept Brahmin Aasteek resisted the orders of the king.
